meanings.sent1: I alphabetise my books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She likes to alphabetise her CDs for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The librarian decided to alphabetise the books by color instead of by title.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were alphabetised neatly in her mind, like a well-organized library.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to alphabetise the words in their spelling list to practice their ABCs.

meanings.sent1: He will alphabetise the names on the guest list.
meanings.sent2: Please alphabetise the files before submitting them.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to alphabetise the ingredients by flavor profile.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were alphabetised in her mind, making it easier to recall them.
meanings.sent5: The secretary alphabetised the documents to make them easier to find later.
